channel.title: Dungeoneering
channel.description: I am level 39 dungeoneering, what floor and complexity is the best to do?

item.title: Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:28, topic:453836”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=556680.msg4076896#msg4076896 date=1344923608]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=556680.msg4076893#msg4076893 date=1344922999]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=556680.msg4076887#msg4076887 date=1344921754]
On a somewhat related note, (mostly because I’m too lazy to find the topic where people were talking about this), I was doing an estimate for 72-80 dungeoneering and they said around 48 mil. Lol. Yea right.
[/quote]that is no where correct.

you get an average of around 35k on abd’s alone. So just do math for 35k each floor for a good estimate.
[/quote]I’m sorry but how can it be nowhere near correct if you go straight to a popular selling clan and ask them for an estimate?
[/quote]You don’t have to go to a clan that does like 3m a floor. Go on runescape forums and go down to the board called “something adventures” I forget the first part. Anyway, there are always people selling floor(s) for like 1-2mish. I spent only around 25m on 70-83 dg.[/quote]

Well, at your average of 35k per dungeon and 1m per dungeon, 25 dungeons would only give you about 875,000 exp, whereas 70-83 is 1,935,487 experience. First of all, if your team does well, the average should really be closer to 45k /dungeon. Even at that rate, you still would have only received 1,125,000 experience. Your numbers seem way off. :S

Read full topic

I spent only around 25m on 70-83 dg.

item.title: Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Jc22493:

Don’t ever scare them!

Well, mostly. I only scare them to get off walls and out of corners. But yes, that’s the tactic. When you walk within 2 squares of them, they will reverse that walk in the opposite direction, for the same number of squares. You can easily herd them around using this idea, only using scare to unstick them.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:18, topic:453836”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=556680.msg4075476#msg4075476 date=1344787955]

Yuck, Taharok. Mediums? Why would you ever?!

Meh, I did mediums solo until about 68 or 69. I wouldn’t recommend that to anyone else, but I wanted to become proficient at dungeoneering before doing group raids.
[/quote]i bet you got ferret puzzles all the time LOL[/quote]

Only a few times. Made me super good at them, though.

item.title: Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Don’t do small c1s until you can start doing mediums in groups. Higher level dungers do c1s so they don’t have to stick with those floors, as they give much lower experience than the higher floors. Do mediums until you’re confident to doing larges. Stick with larges for floors 30+ and do c1s small (solo or grouped) for all under.

Read full topic

item.title: Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Reset every time you get to the highest floor you can.

Read full topic

item.title: Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Pink Phat, post:12, topic:453836”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=556680.msg4075425#msg4075425 date=1344782069]
When you’re not in a floor, open the party interface, and on the bottom, you’ll see “reset”.
[/quote]
thanks :D. and how often should i reset? after i do floors 1-20?[/quote]
When you can’t reach a new floor, you reset and start at floor 1 again.

Read full topic

item.title: Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @Pink_Phat Pink Phat
item.description:
@Pink_Phat wrote:

Jc22493:

Your prestige increases when you reset your progress. Your max prestige is your (dungeoneering level +1) / 2, which is essentially the highest floor you can do.

How does one reset there progress?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Your prestige increases when you reset your progress. Your max prestige is your (dungeoneering level +1) / 2, which is essentially the highest floor you can do.
